intro: Phalangium ciliatum, commonly known as the hairy finger plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in fine, hair-like structures. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Phalangium ciliatum is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
